intro: Mitrasacme arnhemica, commonly known as the Arnhem mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical rainforests of northern Australia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its delicate, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a soft, velvety texture, and it thrives in humid, shaded environments. It is often found growing along riverbanks and in dense undergrowth, contributing to the biodiversity of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
